metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2626 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that libICE before 1.0.9-8 used a weak entropy to generate keys. A local attacker could potentially use this flaw for session hijacking using the information available from the process list.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libice6 - 2:1.0.9-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libice package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.0.9-2').
